        public RPObject loadRPObject(DBTransaction transaction,
                             int objectid)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                             java.io.IOException
        loads an RPObject form the database, using the factory to create the correct subclass
        Parameters:
        transaction - DBTransaction
        objectid - database-id of the RPObject
        Returns:
        RPObject
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an input/output error
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • loadRPObject

        public RPObject loadRPObject(DBTransaction transaction,
                             int objectid,
                             boolean transform)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                             java.io.IOException
        loads an RPObject form the database
        Parameters:
        transaction - DBTransaction
        objectid - database-id of the RPObject
        transform - use the factory to create a subclass of RPObject
        Returns:
        RPObject
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an input/output error
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error

      • readRPObject

        public RPObject readRPObject(int objectid,
                             byte[] data,
                             int protocolVersion,
                             boolean transform)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                             java.io.IOException
        reads an RPObject that has already been loaded from the database
        Parameters:
        objectid - object_id of RPObject
        data - blob data
        protocolVersion - version of serialization protocol
        transform - should it be transformed using the RPObjectFactory
        Returns:
        RPBobject
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an input/output error
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of an database error
